channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Adventure! Senior Perl roles in Malaysia, Dubai and Malta
item.description: Clever folks know that if you’re lucky, you can earn a living and have an adventure at the same time. Enter our international client: online trading is their game, and they’re looking for Perl people with passion, drive, and an appreciation for new experiences.

item.title: Perl Programmer Opportunity - Join a Prominent Tech Publishing Powerhouse in the Philippines
item.description: Our UK-based client is a global leader in the enterprise technology publishing industry, providing audiences worldwide with stimulating perspectives and unique news on enterprise tech that matters today and tomorrow. They are currently seeking a passionate and exceptional Perl programmer based in the Philippines to join their team.

item.title: UK Remote Perl Programmer for Leading Enterprise Tech Publication
item.description: Our client is a global leader in the enterprise technology publishing industry, providing audiences worldwide with stimulating perspectives and unique news on enterprise tech that matters today and tomorrow. They are seeking a talented Perl programmer to manage the full life-cycle of software projects on a remote basis. The ideal candidate must be UK-based and have experience writing high-quality

item.title: Modern Perl and positive team vibes. UK Remote Perl role
item.description: If you’re a Modern Perl developer in the UK with TypeScript or Node and you’re searching for a team of dynamos, we’ve found the perfect place for you. This award-winning company may be newer, but the combined experience of their people is impressive. No doubt this is one of the many reasons their AI recruitment marketing business has taken off!

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Great CPAN modules released last week.

item.title: Counting and sorting
item.description: Use of lambda in Python is fun. Even the Perl magic is worth checking.

item.title: Running Persistence
item.description: Variable free solution in PostScript? Well it is new to me. Thanks for sharing the knowledge.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge #238
item.description: Short and precise description of Perl solutions by the latest champion.

item.title: Running persistence
item.description: Simple yet elegant solution with cool interface to try it yourself. Thank you.

item.title: Be Runnin’ Up That Sum, Be Persisten’ Up That Sort
item.description: You are presented with different ways of dealing a task. Highly recommended.

item.title: Reduced Arrays, Reduced Numbers, Reduced Code
item.description: Nice to know about two cool functions 'reduce' and 'reductions' from List::Utils. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Master of one-liner in Perl is once again sharing another masterpiece. Keep it up great work.
running sums and multiplications
item.description: What a surprise, we got Python for the first time. No wonder, it is the most popular choice after Perl and Raku.

item.title: THE WEEKLY CHALLENGE - 238
item.description: Perl and Raku can be so similar doing the same task. Even Python is not far. Keep sharing the knowledge every week.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 238: Persistence Sort
item.description: Having Raku and Perl solutions side-by-side is fun and easy way to learn the tricks. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 238: Running Sum
item.description: Use of reduction meta-operator in Raku and smilar a;ternate in Perl. Highly recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 238
item.description: Raku once again showing off the cool features. Please checkout the elegant one-liner.

item.title: You Can't Touch This!
item.description: Interesting fact about 238, very impressive. Thanks for sharing the knowledge with us.

item.title: Running and Persistence
item.description: What an inspiration story to begin the blog post, thanks for sharing.

item.title: Persistence Sort, In Which I Give Up and Use a Global
item.description: Recusion seems to be more apt for this task as suggested in the blog post. Well structured post, I must admit.

item.title: Running Sum, or "I ♥️ Recursion”"
item.description: For first time, I would say this is worth checking. Lots of interesting thing for you to take a look.

item.title: Persistently Running
item.description: The cool use of map in Raku, although gather/take could do the job. Plenty of choices available for you in Raku.

item.title: TWC238
item.description: CPAN is always handy when it comes for regular use. The end result is compact and concise.

item.title: Meet The Champion - Robbie Hatley
item.description: Please checkout the interview with the latest champion of The Weekly Challenge.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 238
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Running Sum" and "Persistence Sort" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 239
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks: "Same String" and "Consistent Strings". If you are new to the weekly challenge, why not join us and have fun every week? For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: pushover.net
item.description: A simple command-line Pushover.net notifier script, written in Perl

item.title: Bitcoin::Crypto version 2.000 released!
item.description: Are you Bitcoin fan? Then this is for you, do checkout.

item.title: This week in PSC (120)
item.description: PSC shared the topics last discussed. Thank you PSC.

item.title: Announcing Dancer2 1.0.0
item.description: Latest release of Dancer2 now following semantic versioning. Jason shared the details of latest release.

item.title: #638 - Dancing Perl?
item.description:
Hi there,

What a great and pleasant surprise announcement of the release of Dancer2 1.0.0 by the Dancer Core Team !!!

I am a big fan of Dancer2, so I follow closely the development of my favourite web framework. If you remember there was another announcement recently about change in the core team as Ruth Holloway joining the core team. I am very happy that it is in safe hand and actively developed/maintained by the core team.

The Hacktoberfest 2023 is still going on. Have you done the minimum pull request required to complete the challenge? If not then you still have time to do. Please make sure you submit your pull request before the deadline i.e. last day of the month. In the year 2019, I managed to submit 160 pull requests in one month. Unfortunately for the last couple of years, I haven't participated in the event because of other commitments.

Do you want to play with AI? Luckily we have Navi AI. I strongly recommend, you give it a go.

Last but not the least, let us all pray for the peace in both sides of the conflicts. I don't watch news these days as they are full of heart breaking news.

Enjoy the rest of the newsletter.
item.dc:subject: editorial
